alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 07 at 7:44AM CST until February 07 at 6:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pascagoula River At Graham Ferry affecting Jackson County. For the Pascagoula River...including Graham Ferry...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pascagoula River At Graham Ferry. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, River property at Cumbest Bluff will be cut off by high water and some river roads will be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage later today and fall to 15.0 feet on Sunday, February 12. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.0 feet on 05/05/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
